tables.table_schema: CREATE TABLE security_logs ( log_id INT PRIMARY KEY, log_timestamp TIMESTAMP, log_message TEXT, user_id INT, user_name TEXT, action_type TEXT )

CREATE TABLE security_logs (
  log_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id UUID NOT NULL,
  log_timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  event_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  event_details VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE access_control (
  access_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id UUID NOT NULL,
  resource_id UUID NOT NULL,
  access_level VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  granted BOOLEAN NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE compliance_monitoring (
  record_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id UUID NOT NULL,
  action VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  result VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE security_logs (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  log_time TIMESTAMP,
  log_message TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE access_control (
  user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  username VARCHAR(50),
  access_level VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE compliance_info (
  info_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  info_description TEXT,
  info_source VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE monitoring_info (
  event_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  event_type VARCHAR(50),
  event_timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE Security_Logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    event_description VARCHAR(255),
    user_id INT,
    status VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE Access_Control (
    access_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    device_id INT,
    access_type VARCHAR(50),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE User_Authentication (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50),
    password VARCHAR(50),
    is_admin BOOLEAN,
    last_login TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE Monitoring_Events (
    event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_type VARCHAR(50),
    description VARCHAR(255),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    user_id INT
);
